data.title: Skip action doesn't highlight skip indicator/
data.body: An issue with the value of config.skipping.

data.title: no sound with ffmpeg 1.2 in renpy 6.15.4
data.body:
build OK, but:

gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -march=x86-64 -mtune=generic -O2 -pipe -fstack-protector --param=ssp-buffer-size=4 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Os -fPIC -I. -I/usr/include -I/usr/include/SDL -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c ffdecode.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/ffdecode.o -Wno-unused-function
ffdecode.c: In function 'audio_decode_frame':
ffdecode.c:790:13: warning: 'avcodec_decode_audio3' is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:3994) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
             len1 = avcodec_decode_audio3(dec,
             ^
ffdecode.c:809:17: warning: 'av_audio_resample_init' is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4497) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
                 is->reformat_ctx = av_audio_resample_init(
                 ^
ffdecode.c:833:17: warning: 'audio_resample' is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4505) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
                 len = audio_resample(is->reformat_ctx, (short *) is->audio_buf2, (short *) is->audio_buf1, len);
                 ^
ffdecode.c: In function 'stream_component_close':
ffdecode.c:1106:13: warning: 'audio_resample_close' is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4514) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
             audio_resample_close(is->reformat_ctx);
             ^
ffdecode.c: In function 'decode_thread':
ffdecode.c:1356:6: warning: 'av_close_input_file' is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/libavformat/avformat.h:1689) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
      av_close_input_file(is->ic);
      ^

when run "the question" sample., spam lots avresample error message like:

[audioresample @ 0x7fc660001260] Audio sample format conversion failed

and not sound

greetings

data.title: the F key behaves differently than the toggle windowed/fullscreen in options
data.body:
If you press F key to toggle windowed/fullscreen, when you go back to windowed the window size is not the original anymore.
Example: I set my game 1024x600 but have a 1920x1200 monitor. Pressing F goes fullscreen, then I press F again and the resulting window is not 1024x600 anymore but way bigger (not sure exactly which size, but almost whole screen).
The same behavior doesn't repeat if I use the button in options screen.

data.title: Documentation for "Image Name" in "Elements of Statement" is duplicated
data.body:
In language_basics:

> An image name consists of one or more names, separated by spaces.

is duplicated

data.title: Documentation is too old around the launcher
data.body:
In quickstart:

> **Choosing and Launching a Project.** You should first see what the completed _The Question_ game looks like. To do this, start the Ren'Py launcher, and choose "Select Project". A menu of projects will come up. Choose "the_question" from it. You'll be returned to the main menu, and you can now choose "Launch" to start _The Question_.

"Select Project" was removed and we can choose "The Question" directly in "PROJECTS:"

> You can get back to the Ren'Py demo by doing the same thing, but choosing "demo" instead of "the_question".

I can't find "demo"

> **Creating a new Project.** Create a new project by choosing "New Project" from the launcher. The launcher will ask you to choose a template. Choose "template". The launcher will then ask you for a project name. Since "the_question" is already taken, you should enter something different, like "My Question". The launcher will then ask you to choose a color theme for the project. It doesn't matter what you pick at this point, just choose something that appeals to you. You'll be returned to the top menu of the launcher with your new game chosen.

"New Project" is renamed to "+Create New Project" and some steps are changed.

> To try this out, go into the launcher, change to the "My Question" project, and pick "Edit Script". This will open the script files in a text editor. Choose the script.rpy file, and erase everything in it. We're starting from scratch, so you don't need what's there. Copy the example above into script.rpy, and save it.

"Edit Script" was sepalated to some menus.

> You're now ready to run this example. Go back to the launcher, and click Run. Ren'Py will start up. Notice how, without any extra work, Ren'Py has given you menus that let you load and save the game, and change various preferences. When ready, click "Start Game", and play through this example game.

"Run" is renamed to "Launch Project"

> In the Launcher, you should go to the Tools page, and pick "Check Script (Lint)". This will check your games for errors that may affect some users. These errors can affect users on the Mac and Linux platforms, so it's important to fix them all, even if you don't see them on your computer.

"Tools" page was removed.

> From the Tools page, click distribute. The launcher will check your script again, ask you a few questions, and then build the distribution of your game.

"distribute" was renamed to "Build Distributions"

data.title: viewport is set to wrong vertical offset when Ume P Gothic is used
data.body:
- Situation and expected result:
  In the following example script:
  https://gist.github.com/vbkaisetsu/aa3162bbb5dedb508c14
  the viewport has 10 long texts and some style properties are set. yinitial of the viewport is set to 1.0 (bottom side)
- Actual result
  The viewport doesn't show the bottom side of the vbox first.

It uses Ume P Gothic as a default font. When I use VL Gothic, it doesn't occur.
I found this bug on Ren'Py 6.15.2

Screenshot:
![Screenshot_from_2013-03-29 10:59:42](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2175479/316387/10eefad8-9815-11e2-8955-a68b52ff45f0.png)

Full example source:
http://ubuntuone.com/5bLZGudxivKZWYc6Pnbk1x

data.title: Black screen while loading movies
data.body: While loading a movie using `renpy.movie_cutscene` (and presumably also when using movie displayables), Ren'Py shows a full black screen. This looks pretty crappy if the first few frames of your movie are anything but opaque black.

data.title: Multi character
data.body:
This branch adds MultiCharacter which shows two or more dialogues in a window.

Here is an example script and a screen shot.
https://gist.github.com/vbkaisetsu/136088bc34e26b3d12ec

Movie:
http://youtu.be/4TByQj4tHdc

data.title: Can' quick save Ren'Py 6.15.2
data.body:
Can't quick save with Ren'Py 6.15.2

For example.
Launch tutorial and start game.
Open game menu and "Save Game".
Open autosave page.
Close menu.

And try to quick save, but it is insensitive.

data.body:
<Shiz> when playing a movie fullscreen using renpy.movie_cutscene
<Shiz> and then pressing the OS'es close button
<Shiz> it shows the yesno prompt to close the game
<Shiz> but there is no mouse cursor

data.title: Indent at end of file
data.body:
(07:20:31 PM) RenPyTom: Sure, although editor support would be much better.
(07:21:11 PM) Jake Staines: That reminds me, actually - are you aware that the Ren'Py mode in Editra doesn't correctly indent when you're working right at the very end of a file?
(07:21:21 PM) RenPyTom: no!
(07:21:23 PM) Jake Staines: As in, if you start a new file, type:
(07:21:25 PM) Jake Staines: label something:
(07:21:34 PM) Jake Staines: and hit enter, the cursor goes to the start of the line.
(07:21:53 PM) Jake Staines: (even after it's been saved as a .rpy)
(07:22:15 PM) Jake Staines: I come across it every now and again when I'm adding stuff to the end of a file, and keep forgetting to mention it.

data.title: Failure to build with anything modern for FFmpeg
data.body:
Renpy (6.14.1) fails to build with modern FFmpeg. This is FFmpeg 1.1 but this would fail going back a few versions too.

ffdecode.c: In function 'audio_decode_frame':
ffdecode.c:790: warning: 'avcodec_decode_audio3' is deprecated (declared at /usr/local/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:3996)
ffdecode.c:809: warning: 'av_audio_resample_init' is deprecated (declared at /usr/local/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4502)
ffdecode.c:833: warning: 'audio_resample' is deprecated (declared at /usr/local/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4505)
ffdecode.c: In function 'stream_component_close':
ffdecode.c:1106: warning: 'audio_resample_close' is deprecated (declared at /usr/local/include/libavcodec/avcodec.h:4514)
ffdecode.c: In function 'decode_thread':
ffdecode.c:1155: error: 'AVFormatParameters' undeclared (first use in this function)
ffdecode.c:1155: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once
ffdecode.c:1155: error: for each function it appears in.)
ffdecode.c:1155: error: expected ';' before 'params'
ffdecode.c:1165: error: 'ap' undeclared (first use in this function)
error: command 'cc' failed with exit status 1

data.title: Can't set projects directory on OS X
Avira detects as HEUR/ELF.Malformed
data.body:
Avira Antivirus Premium 2013 detects the following files as [HEUR/ELF.Malformed](https://www.avira.com/en/support-threats-description/tid/5245/tlang/en)
- /lib/linux-i686/python
- /lib/linux-i686/pythonw
- /lib/linux-i686/renpy
- /lib/linux-i686/zsync
- /lib/linux-i686/zsyncmake
- /lib/linux-x86_64/python
- /lib/linux-x86_64/pythonw
- /lib/linux-x86_64/renpy
- /lib/linux-x86_64/zsync
- /lib/linux-x86_64/zsyncmake

data.title: Fix crashing Renpy, when inputed string contain '[' character.
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Run tutorial
2. Go to 'User Interaction' chapter
3. Go to question 'What is your name?'
4. Enter the name, that contains '[' character, for example 'qwe[rty'
5. Renpy is crashing and printing exception:

**Traceback:**

``` 
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 113, in script call
  File "game/demo_ui.rpy", line 245, in script
Exception: String u'qwe[rty' ends with an open format operation.

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/execution.py", line 288, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/ast.py", line 453, in execute
    renpy.exports.say(who, what, interact=self.interact)
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/exports.py", line 752, in say
    who(what, interact=interact)
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/character.py", line 772, in __call__
    who = who_pattern.replace("[who]", sub(who))
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/substitutions.py", line 223, in substitute
    s = formatter.vformat(s, (), kwargs)
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-deps-master/install/lib/python2.7/string.py", line 549, in vformat
    result = self._vformat(format_string, args, kwargs, used_args, 2)
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-deps-master/install/lib/python2.7/string.py", line 558, in _vformat
    self.parse(format_string):
  File "/home/likewise-open/DALSTRAZH/markelovaa/sources/renpy-master/renpy/substitutions.py", line 157, in parse
    raise Exception("String {0!r} ends with an open format operation.".format(s))
Exception: String u'qwe[rty' ends with an open format operation.

Linux-3.2.0-38-generic-pae-i686-with-debian-wheezy-sid
Ren'Py 6.15.0.0
Ren'Py Tutorial 6.15 "Foreign Policy"
```

![square_bracket_bug_1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1083576/220024/cf01e1f2-8555-11e2-99a6-650cae3ce658.jpg)

![square_bracket_bug_2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1083576/220026/d682f092-8555-11e2-8929-7b82670bae38.jpg)

data.title: Errors in Katawa Shoujo with Ren'Py 6.14.1
data.body:
I'm getting the following errors when trying to run Katawa Shoujo with Ren'Py 6.14.1:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "/Developer/Projects/ks_svn/Katawa Shoujo/game/imachine.rpy", line 264, in script call
  File "/Developer/Projects/ks_svn/Katawa Shoujo/game/_ui_early.rpy", line 177, in script call
  File "/Developer/Projects/ks_svn/Katawa Shoujo/game/script-a1-thursday.rpy", line 812, in script
TypeError: OldMoveTransition() got an unexpected keyword argument 'time_warp'

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/execution.py", line 266, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/ast.py", line 1028, in execute
    renpy.exports.with_statement(trans, paired)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/exports.py", line 939, in with_statement
    return renpy.game.interface.do_with(trans, paired, clear=clear)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/display/core.py", line 1512, in do_with
    clear=clear)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/display/core.py", line 1813, in interact
    repeat, rv = self.interact_core(preloads=preloads, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/display/core.py", line 2016, in interact_core
    new_widget=layers_root)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/renpy614/renpy/curry.py", line 38, in __call__
    **dict(self.kwargs.items() + kwargs.items()))
TypeError: OldMoveTransition() got an unexpected keyword argument 'time_warp'

Linux-3.7.9-gentoo-x86_64-AMD_FX-tm-6100_Six-Core_Processor-with-gentoo-2.1
Ren'Py 6.14.1.366
```

Katawa Shoujo comes with bundled Ren'Py 6.10.2e, which is quiet ancient by now.

data.title: Rollback in NVL has a bug on 6.15 translated tutorial
data.body:
When I play the tutorial game with Japanese translation, rollback doesn't work correctly in NVL mode. It doesn't ocuur in English tutorial.

Step to reproduce:
1. launch tutorial game and change language to Japanese, then start a game.
2. select NVL mode (NVL)
3. click twice
4. press "Page Up" key

the first line will be duplicated.

Before rollback:
![Screenshot_from_2013-02-28 18:59:19](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2175479/204857/b1934758-818d-11e2-9248-7c86f9882f41.png)
After rollback:
![Screenshot_from_2013-02-28 18:59:32](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2175479/204859/ba3f0f0e-818d-11e2-82f4-759b8aded1c4.png)

data.title: Problem with overlapping imagemaps
data.body:
In the imagemap below, the upper-left hotspot will change its size depending on whether the mouse is hovering over it or not.

``` python
# Assuming 800x600 window
screen im_overlap:
    imagemap:
        ground "800x600.jpg" hover "another_800x600.jpg"
        hotspot (0,0,800,600) clicked Return("Anywhere")
        hotspot (0,0,200,200) clicked Return("Upper Left")
        xpos 0 ypos 0
```
